p: Taking into account the EO content similarities between harvests for the varieties cultivated in the greenhouse, four clusters were formed ( Figure 1). Cluster 1 consists of samples OCK1, OCK3, and OCP4, with linalool, trans-α-bergamontene, and eugenol as the dominant components. Cluster 2 consists of samples OCP5, OCS6, and OCS7, with linalool and eugenol as the dominant components. Cluster 3 is “simplicifolious” and consists of OCK2 with major constituents linalool and trans-α-bergamontene. Finally, cluster 4 consists of OCM8, OCM9, and OCM10 with major components linalool, methyl chavichol, and trans-α-bergamontene ( Figure 2).
